result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey M. Wierzba was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Any assessment/treatment/counseling. Defendant must register as Sex Offender for a period of 15 years. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey M. Wierzba

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CF1156 and 15CF1062 called: 3:08pm
State appears by ADA R.Uttke; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney Dave Casey

State has reviewed PSI and has no corrections; Atty Casey makes corrections.
COURT notes review of letters written on behalf of defendant.

Argument by State on sentencing recommendation.
Argument by Atty Casey on sentencing recommendation.
Defendant makes statement.

COURT ORDERS:
15CF1156 -
Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>Sentence W/held; 2 years Probation.
1 year MCJ jail as condition of that probation.

15CF1062 -
Ct. 1 (Child Enticement-Expose Genitals)>>10 years TOTAL: 4 years incarceration and 6 years ES
Ct. 3 (Sex with Child Age 16/Older)>>9 months MCJ
CONDITIONS of Probation/ES>>
No contact with 18 years old or under; Any assessment/treatment/counseling; CC; No Contact with victim; Defendant must register as sex offender for a period of 15 years.

>>All sentences to run concurrent.
>>Defendant is NOT eligible for CIP and ERP
>>Credit for 325 days of time already served on each sentence

All parties to keep their PSI reports.

Adj: 4:03pm

Support Letters for Sentencing to Court from Atty Casey
dated 10/27/16

Interfaced to DOC
Emailed copies to DA's office and Atty Casey

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CF1082 and 15CF1156 called: 3:30pm
State appears by ADA R.Uttke.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Dave Casey.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State files amended information in 15CF1062 - COURT accepts.
State moves to:
15CF1156 - Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI
15CF1156 - Ct. 3 (Intimidate Victim/Dissuade)>>D&RI
15CF1062 - Ct. 2>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE 

PLEA:
15CF1062 - Ct. 1 (Child Enticement)>>GUILTY
15CF1062 - Ct. 3 (Sexual Intercourse with Child)>>GUILTY
15CF1156 - Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY


COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: PSI to be completed in approximately 60 days.

Adj: 3:49pm
for Consolidation of Cases for Trial - includes 15CF1062 & 15CF1156 - stj

Clerk Cheree
Cases15CF1062 and 15CF1156 called: 9:07am
State appears by ADA L Gramer; Defendant appears in person/in custody with Atty Paul Goetz.
(Motion to Modify Bond)

COURT notes Atty Goetz has filed Motion to Modify Bond in both cases dated 1/14/16.
Argument by Atty Goetz on modification of bond; Argument by State - COURT denies Motion to Modify Bond.

Parties to set further dates - State notes ARGN already held in both cases.

Adj: 9:14am

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CF1062 and 15CF1156 Called: 10:07am
State appears by ADA K.Mayo; Deft appears in person/in custody and with Atty Paul Goetz
Waivers of Prelim. filed in both files.  

Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.
Plea:  NOT GUILTY
Dates to be set.
ATty Goetz requests bond modification - COURT notes that matter can be set with Br. 4 and will not take up modification today.
Bond:  Continued

C: Br. 4

Adj: 10:11am
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond - includes 15CF1062 & 15C1156 - stj

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): B.S.B. (non-waivable).  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
